title: Does anyone even use Minion Dematerializers?
body:
I can understand what they were trying to do with this rune (slightly better wave control in lane and stronger pushing power), but its really outclassed by both of the other options in that part of the tree.  Let's see....5% bonus damage to minions, 350 free gold and 10 otherwise unobtainable movement speed , or the ability to 
finish items when you're just short of gold.  Tough choice.  

They really should give it something.  Either buff the bonus damage to add a full 4-5% per use, reduce the penalization for additional stacks, or maybe let junglers use them on jungle camps for 50-100 up front damage and a permanent damage increase on the whole camp.  Heck, even swapping places in the rune tree with biscuits or something might make it a more appealing option.

replies.body: It helps waveclear faster which could be useful in splitpush or pushing in the wave to roam. Not essential but choose if you like it.

But it really doesn't, i took it a few time on lux to allow me to clear casters early with just 1 e without having to buy a luden 2nd after morello item but i still cant 1 shot caster minions even if i have the max damage amp on castor minions.

I mean I just never buy Luden's on Lux now because Minion Dematerializer covers the clearing.  It's also more consistent.

Just Morello isn't enough, but you get there pretty quick.

Thing is after morello depending on what you buy you kill them anyway. I usually go rabadon on Lux (I find she's one of the few mages I feel ok buying it on) and at that point E clears casters. I tried the rune and the difference is at that point when you have morello+rab components.. With rune you clear with only the 2 bigger components, without you need the book too.
i would like to go morello into banshee or hourglass but those dont give enough ap to clear casters even though i can kill champions without magic resist fine
I don't like go defensive on Lux.. except specific matchups, I feel like if I need the item it means I fucked up big time anyway xD
Eh I take Banshees against a team with like TF and Ashe for instance.
I tend to go Morello, NLR, Haunting Guise with Sorc boots along the way.  The flat magic pen just makes my burst much more reliable at that point in the game.

I like it on {{summoner:12}} {{champion:83}} 
with {{item:3512}} or {{item:3056}} and {{item:3060}}
Does the entire concept of architecture just piss you off, or did a building slaughter your friends and family like Itachi right in front of you?
i use it on support zoe to take spells from minions in lane and on ranged supports like thresh and rakan to trigger targon easy

I looked at it for zoe sup too

It's not worth the expense on Thresh though, zombie ward is incredibly OP on supports.
Really? I've found Ghost Poro to be more useful, at least in laning.

If your ward dies naturally, it counts as you 'killing a ward' so I find mid + late I can have own side jungle lit up solo.

Ghost poro's better against the ganks and tps though.

The value is in the lane control it affords. It helps alot in bad match ups where you are often being pushed into your turret.

It's hard to predict bad match ups in bot lane though, since the player caliber of either support is always a toss up.

To break even with Slightly Magical Boots in the context you mentioned that small amount of damage/Dematerializer procs would need to be the difference between catching or missing 350 gold worth of CS.  So like 15-18 creeps throughout a game.  How does it help with a bad match-up beyond that? By bad match-up I assume you're referring to a lane where your opponent has relatively permanent pressure on you.

It really depends on matchup but what you can do is use it on cannon, and then go in on enemy when he tries to get his. You either chunk him, or you deny him gold if he steps back. Not to mention you will have improved waveclear through whole game.

Want to try it on Heimer top. 3 uses on melee minions, so turrets can kill them faster. 2 on caster, 1 on cannon. Save one for super if you need. You'll push wave fast, take turrets faster.

Like Spell book it's a specialist thing indeed and a hard one to truely utilise fully.
My issue with it is that If you push too far in the beginning and even mid game, it throws you out of position and available for enemy ganks. Splitpushers I imagine would like this though

idk about split pushers. Mid/lategame champs tear through creeps so fast that 5% is negligible.  They also get a relatively similar effect through both of the other rune options.  Boots speed your build up by 350g so you are usually at least a component item up from where you would have been (i.e. more damage to clear faster).  Futures Market you can also grab extra component items if need be and finish that Shiv after a bad forced back.
I would switch cosmic insights and minion dematerializers position. I think that would kinda force you to take it or it would just completely nullify the other two like they aren't used already.

I don't have the client open in front of me, but Cosmic insight is the 5% CDR, and the other 2 are the ramping up ap/ad over time and the....river bonus? It would certainly be more competitive in that part of the tree
It's in the inspiration tree next to approach velocity and celestial body. You're talking about the sorcery path. But I got your point.
I think this is a problem with many different runes currently... There is just one that outclasses most of the other alternatives
I use them on Gangplank so that I can clear waves easier with my barrel q's for stacks.
It's 470g free, not 350, each point of MS and extra 50g is easily calculated.

Thresh would likely use it in low ELO games, and possibly even In high ones. Shield Rakan might use it, too, as might a Shield Zoe (who would want it to be able to get those balloons). Hell, any ranged support that wanted to get Shield would probably take it.

It _might_ also see use in hard-counter matchups (or against Pantheon), where you're not even sure if you're gonna be able to CS, but I'm not certain about that.

A lot of the Inspiration tree is niche, and I think that's intentional.

I have seen it being used once on a lux for some reason.

But Inspiration seems to have a lot of runes that are barely being used. I have seen one person use Unsealed Spellbook (a Nasus) and one person use Glacial Augment (A morgana).  Have seen Hextech Flashtraption maybe twice. Celestial Body and Approach Velocity are a bit harder to spot, but I think I have seen them a couple times on some tanks or a Soraka, but I doubt I have seen them more then 4-5 times.

The whole tree feels to me as an idea that didn't worked out. There is one keystone that is only good on a handfull of champs (Klepto on Ez/Sona/Gp), and a couple good small runes. Rest are to situational or just plain weak/useless.

Hi I use it On Le blanc and it feels core with her since it turns your WQ in more efficient waveclear

make it jump by 1.5% for each additional use rather than just 1%

It's probably gonna be something the Koreans end up figuring out something crazy for.
